Uses of Class
TowerDefense.Direction

    • Uses of Direction in TowerDefense

      Methods in TowerDefense that return Direction 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Direction Direction.getOrderedDirection(int number)
      Mods your input by 4, then returns the consistent, corresponding Direction.
      static Direction Direction.oppositeOf(Direction direction) 
      static Direction Direction.valueOf(java.lang.String name)
      Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name.
      static Direction[] Direction.values()
      Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared.
      Methods in TowerDefense with parameters of type Direction 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tile Tile.getTileTo(Direction direction)
      Returns the tile in the corresponding direction of this one.
      static Direction Direction.oppositeOf(Direction direction) 
      boolean Tile.pathBranchesTo(Direction direction)
      If this Tile is setup to be part of the Path, returns true if one of the directions it branches in is the chosen direction.
      boolean Tile.pathBranchesWithoutConnectingTo(Direction direction)
      Returns true if this Tile branches in a direction, but the Tile in that direction (if any) doesn't branch in our direction.
      boolean Tile.pathConnectsTo(Direction direction)
      Returns true if this Tile is capable of connecting to form part of a Path with the Tile in the specified direction.
      void Character.setStatVisualDirection(Direction d)
      Set the direction in which the character's stats should appear, relative to the character.
